channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023080572
item.description:
Report E-2023080572

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: RUSSELLVILLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LLR experienced a customer location release of UN1760 SNB-130 from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 1' x 15' area of the trailer floor. The tote was punctured by a loading strap, resulting in the release. The crew transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new one. Citric acid solution was then deployed to neutralize the impacted area and then collected with absorbents. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged hauled to the XPO terminal in Little Rock, AR and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080663
item.description:
Report E-2023080663

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: JONESBORO
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into two of the poly 2.5 gallon jugs of norox (un3105) releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023070467
item.description:
Report X-2023070467

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car began leaking from the middle hopper door as it was going over the hump. Car man secured the door which was less than 1" open. The car was set out and inspected and seals were on all hopper doors and the dogs were operational. The car was diverted back to El Dorado Chemical.
